answers.answer: Hi.TSH of 6.5 would be too high, particularly if you have symptoms.  Most endo's would treat at this level.  The old range was up to 5.5.  New range is up to 3.5.  Regardless your TSH is high (though not terribly high).  Apparently most people feel best with a TSH of between 1 and 2.  Some doctors however choose not to treat unless levels are significantly high.Worst case, you should be monitoring regularly.  Repeat test in 6 weeks.  If still high then consider treatment.You need to ask your doctor specifically about treating this.  Treatment is thyroid hormone.  It is just 1 small pill a day.  Considering  you have other things going on, I'd think it's important to make sure that thyroid is optimal.  Hypothyroid increases risk factor for heart disease (along with your high cholesterol AND diabetes), so I would think that you should treat this.In meantime read up on hypothyroid and see if any symptoms ring a bell.... you might feel surprisingly better if this is appropriately treated.Best wishes.
